Token.Abstract: The RKManagedObjectStore class encapsulates a Core Data stack including a managed object model, a persistent store coordinator, and a set of managed object contexts. The managed object store simplifies the task of properly setting up a Core Data stack and provides some additional functionality, such as the use of a seed database to initialize a SQLite backed persistent store and a simple code path for resetting the store by destroying and recreating the persistent stores.
Returns the default managed object store for the application.
Sets the default managed object store for the application.

Parameter.Name: managedObjectStore
Parameter.Abstract: The new default managed object store.

Token.Abstract: Initializes the receiver with a given managed object model. This is the designated initializer for RKManagedObjectStore.

Parameter.Name: managedObjectModel
Parameter.Abstract: The managed object model with which to initialize the receiver.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The receiver, initialized with the given managed object model.

Token.Abstract: Initializes the receiver with an existing persistent store coordinator.

Parameter.Name: persistentStoreCoordinator
Parameter.Abstract: The persistent store coordinator with which to initialize the receiver.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The receiver, initialized with the managed object model of the given persistent store coordinator and the persistent store coordinator.

Token.Abstract: Initializes the receiver with a managed object model obtained by merging the models from all of the application's non-framework bundles.
Creates a persistent store coordinator with the receiver's managed object model. After invocation, the persistentStoreCoordinator property will no longer be nil.
Adds a new in memory persistent store to the persistent store coordinator of the receiver.

Parameter.Name: error
Parameter.Abstract: On input, a pointer to an error object. If an error occurs, this pointer is set to an actual error object containing the error information. You may specify nil for this parameter if you do not want the error information.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The new persistent store, or nil in the event of an error.

Token.Abstract: Adds a new SQLite persistent store, optionally initialized with a seed database, to the persistent store coordinator of the receiver.

Parameter.Name: storePath
Parameter.Abstract: The path at which to save the persistent store on disk.

Parameter.Name: seedPath
Parameter.Abstract: An optional path to a seed database to copy to the given storePath in the event that a store does not yet exist.

Parameter.Name: error
Parameter.Abstract: On input, a pointer to an error object. If an error occurs, this pointer is set to an actual error object containing the error information. You may specify nil for this parameter if you do not want the error information.

Token.Abstract: Resets the persistent stores in the receiver's persistent store coordinator and recreates them. If a store being reset is backed by a file on disk (such as a SQLite file), the file will be removed prior to recreating the store. If the store was originally created using a seed database, the seed will be recopied to reset the store to its seeded state.

Parameter.Name: error
Parameter.Abstract: On input, a pointer to an error object. If an error occurs, this pointer is set to an actual error object containing the error information. You may specify nil for this parameter if you do not want the error information.

ReturnValue.Abstract: A Boolean value indicating if the reset was successful.

Token.Abstract: Returns the managed object model of the receiver.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The managed object model of the receiver.

Token.Abstract: Returns the managed object model of the receiver.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The managed object model of the receiver.

Token.Abstract: Returns the persistent store coordinator of the receiver.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The persistent store coordinator of the receiver.

Token.Abstract: Returns the persistent store coordinator of the receiver.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The persistent store coordinator of the receiver.

Token.Abstract: The managed object cache associated with the receiver.
The managed object cache associated with the receiver.
Creates the persistent store and main queue managed object contexts for the receiver.
Returns the managed object context of the receiver that is associated with the persistent store coordinator and is responsible for managing persistence.
Returns the managed object context of the receiver that is associated with the persistent store coordinator and is responsible for managing persistence.
The main queue managed object context of the receiver.
The main queue managed object context of the receiver.
Creates a new child managed object context of the persistent store managed object context with a given concurrency type.

Parameter.Name: concurrencyType
Parameter.Abstract: The desired concurrency type for the new context.

ReturnValue.Abstract: A newly created managed object context with the given concurrency type whose parent is the persistentStoreManagedObjectContext.

Token.Abstract: Adds search indexing to the entity for the given name in the receiver's managed object model.

Parameter.Name: entityName
Parameter.Abstract: The name of the entity in the receiver's managed object model that should be made searchable.

Parameter.Name: attributes
Parameter.Abstract: An array of NSAttributeDescription objects or NSString attribute names specifying the NSStringAttributeType attributes that are to be indexed for searching.

Token.Abstract: The search indexer for the receiver's primary managed object context.
The search indexer for the receiver's primary managed object context.
Tells the search indexer to begin observing the persistent store managed object context for changes to searchable entities and updating the search words.
Tells the search indexer to stop observing the persistent store managed object context for changes to searchable entities.
